N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 177.14 - Notification to ombudsman of youth's need for legal counsel

State Regulations
(a) The facility or program director shall
immediately notify the office of the ombudsman whenever it comes to his/her
attention that a youth under his/her care: (1)
has been or is about to be arrested by a law enforcement official; (2)
has been served with the order of a
court, a subpoena or a summons; or
(3)
is in need of legal counsel. (b) Whenever a youth has been or
is about to be arrested by a law enforcement official, the ombudsman shall take
steps to insure that the youth is provided with adequate legal
representation. (c) When a youth is
to be interrogated or interviewed by a law enforcement official concerning a
criminal act, or by any person concerning a civil or criminal matter, the
ombudsman may request to be present during such interrogation or interview; however, the ombudsman shall not serve as the youth's attorney or legal
representative. Notes
